Today, Dan and Jordan discuss an episode of Project Camelot where Sweary Kerry interviews a guy who claims to have worked for the Department of Defense in a top secret capacity, but seems to want to talk more about his very interesting career in show business.

==Tidbits==

*Ronald Farnham is not a pornographer
*15 years in signal intelligence
*Left active duty just before 9/11
*worked as a contractor in DC after 9/11 on a CIA contract
*Ronald can't tell who was in charge when he was working with the government
*Ronald solves 9/11, maybe admits to felonies
*Ronald couldn't find 9/11 info. It's either been scrubbed, or it's reclassified
*Ronald was classmates with 2 9/11 hijackers
*Ronald had top secret clearance with no degree
*"Get married" was code term used by classmates
*Ronald lost his job for sending a plan to end world terrorism to NSA
*Kerry isn't allowed to say False Flag on YouTube
*Why isn't Ronald a leaker like Snowden?
*Ronald investigated JFK, but all the top secret documents match the official story
*Ronald wrote a book: Second Coming of the Messiah
*Ronald heavily implies he's the Messiah
*Ronald wrote a sequel to the Bible
*Ronald talks about his new movie, The Lines of Destiny
*Kerry hits Ronald with "Cool story, bro"
*Ronald was on America's Got Talent and Guiness World Records for plunger throwing
*Ronald doesn't feel welcome in East LA
*Dan is a sovereign citizen
*Ronald's plan is for people to write promissory notes to the bank, get money, and free themselves from financial slavery
*Bank wouldn't accept Ronald's promissory note, he emailed Pam Bondi, she wouldn't take his case
*Kerry says be careful, references Sean David Morton
*Ronald is a flat earther
*War on terror will end, be replaced by fake alien invasion
*Once the banks accept the promissory notes, theres no point in crime
*Ronald has a GoFundMe, offers promissory not template and guide to become a sovereign citizen
*Kerry asks how he will make a movie without using the Federal Reserve
*Kerry bans people from her chat for speech she doesn't agree with
